top_categories.workout_context: Iron Cross' PA hills, Cyclocross elements forces constant power changes. Surge over the rough stuff, settle on the smooth, repeat for 60 miles.
Race-pace efforts that mimic Iron Cross' demands. Pacing, fueling, and tactical decisions under fatigue. Practice the race before October.
75ft/mi means long efforts at or near FTP on every climb. If your threshold cracks at minute 15, you'll walk the rest.
At Iron Cross, surges push you above threshold and you have to recover while still riding. Over-unders train exactly that.
88–92% FTP is where you'll spend the hardest sustained miles of Iron Cross. Train it until it feels boring.
How long can you hold 105% FTP before you blow? At Iron Cross, that number decides whether you bridge or get dropped.
When someone attacks on pA hilly gravel with cyclocross elements, you have 10 seconds to respond or you're off the back. This builds that response.
60 miles on pA hilly gravel with cyclocross elements burns energy faster than the distance suggests. Train the fade resistance now.
Varied gradients on pA hilly gravel with cyclocross elements demand climbing versatility. Sit the shallow stuff, stand the steep stuff, switch without thinking.
Short, max efforts are unavoidable. Punchy climbs, gap closures, attacks on pA hilly gravel with cyclocross elements. If you haven't trained them, you'll crack.
Double-threshold training builds sustained power with less fatigue. More FTP per hour of training.
Smooth pedaling at 60 miles saves muscle. Bad technique at mile 10 is invisible. At mile 80 it's a cramp.

race_overlay.nutrition: Target 40–60g carbs/hour for Iron Cross’s 60 miles. Front-load calories in the first half. One bottle per hour minimum, more in heat.
race_overlay.terrain: Mixed terrain at Iron Cross requires surface adaptability. Include weekly rides on pa hilly gravel with cyclocross elements to build confidence. Expect: pa hills, cyclocross elements, regional event.

pack_summary: This 10-workout pack focuses on Gravel Specific, Race Simulation, and TT Threshold to prepare you for 60 miles of pa hilly gravel with cyclocross elements in Pennsylvania.
